org.apache.hadoop.examples

Class BaileyBorweinPlouffe

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
      • org.apache.hadoop.examples.BaileyBorweinPlouffe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable, org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool

    public class BaileyBorweinPlouffe
extends org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
implements org.apache.hadoop.util.Tool
    A map/reduce program that uses Bailey-Borwein-Plouffe to compute exact digits of Pi. This program is able to calculate digit positions lower than a certain limit, which is roughly 10^8. If the limit is exceeded, the corresponding results may be incorrect due to overflow errors. For computing higher bits of Pi, consider using distbbp. Reference: [1] David H. Bailey, Peter B. Borwein and Simon Plouffe. On the Rapid Computation of Various Polylogarithmic Constants. Math. Comp., 66:903-913, 1996.
